itemDescription: English officer who led Bengal Native Infantry troops during the Indian Rebellion of 1857

wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant-General Sir Francis Booth Norman (25 April 1830 – 25 June 1901) was an English officer of the Bengal Army, who led Bengal Native Infantry troops during the Indian Rebellion of 1857, the Second Anglo-Afghan War, and a number of small conflicts on the frontiers of British India.
